intro: Cerinthe glabra proles tenuiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered smooth cerinthe, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged oppositely. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular blue or purple flowers, which are attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This species is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats across southern Europe and parts of the Mediterranean region.
